name: Huancaina Sauce
author: aelionei
summary: This is traditional Peruvian spicy cheese sauce, often served over boiled and sliced potatoes. The recipe was created based on my experiences living in Peru and makes for a delicious and easy dinner starter. Serve at room temperature or cold over boiled potatoes and top with sliced boiled eggs and kalamata olives; dust with paprika (or rocoto if you have some).
ingredients: 3  aji amarillo peppers, seeded and chopped, or more to taste
salt and ground black pepper to taste
directions: Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat; saute onion, aji peppers, and garlic until onion softens and mixture is bright yellow, 5 to 10 minutes
Transfer mixture to a blender; add milk and blend until smooth
Add queso fresco and crackers to mixture and blend until sauce is smooth and the consistency of thick yogurt
